hook.text: A company added constructive conflict to their core values. New hires were surprised. Veterans loved it.

buildup.text: Most organizations say they value open communication. Few actually reward disagreement.

discovery.text: Dean Tjosvold's research: conflict-positive organizations outperform conflict-avoidant ones.

twist.text: Making conflict a value isn't about creating chaos. It's about creating honest communication.

climax.text: Reward people who raise uncomfortable truths. Promote those who resolve, not just those who comply.

punchline.text: Organizations that embrace conflict outgrow those that fear it.

quiz.question: What characterizes a conflict-positive organization?
options: It rewards honest disagreement and treats conflict as valuable
It eliminates all sources of workplace tension
It only allows senior leaders to raise concerns
